intro: Ipomopsis spicata var. orchidacea, commonly known as the orchidaceous ipomopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
